metadata.title: Install Plugins
metadata.description: Install external Packer plugins that extend Packer functionality.

outlineItems.title: Manually install plugins using the CLI
Authenticate requests to the GitHub API

mdxSource.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={};const MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components,...props}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...props,components:components,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`This topic describes how to install external plugins for Packer. Refer to `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/packer/docs/plugins"},`Packer Plugins Overview`),` for additional information about plugins.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"overview"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#overview","aria-label":"overview permalink"},`\xbb`),`Overview`),mdx("p",null,`Specify one or more required plugins in a Packer template and run the initialization command. During initialization, Packer queries the source repository for plugins specified in the template that match the version constraints for the host operating system. Packer downloads and installs plugins and other dependencies specified in the template.`),mdx("p",null,`You can specify a remote project on GitHub for Packer to install the plugin from. Refer to `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"#requirements"},`Requirements`),` for additional information about installing plugins from a remote source.`),mdx("p",null,`When you run the Packer template, Packer first checks the directory for installed plugins that match the version requirements specified in the template. If a suitable version of the plugin is not installed, Packer prints an error. Packer downloads the required version from the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`source`),` configuration.`),mdx("h3",{"id":"manual-installation-method"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#manual-installation-method","aria-label":"manual installation method permalink"},`\xbb`),`Manual installation method`),mdx("p",null,`You can manually install plugins if you are unable to specify plugins in an HCL template file. You may need to use the manual plugin installation method if the plugin source is a non-GitHub project or if your plugins are still in development.`),mdx("p",null,`Manually install a plugin using the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`packer plugins install`),` command. You specify a local or remote plugin source and include a path to the binary to generate the SHA256SUM file required to load the plugin during Packer builds. Refer to `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"#requirements"},`Requirements`),` for additional information about installing plugins from a remote source.`),mdx("p",null,`Note that Packer checks the plugin installation directory against the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`required_plugins`),` block in the Packer template when you build artifacts using the template. Plugins specified in the template that have been installed manually must still comply with the version constraints set in the template.`),mdx("h3",{"id":"installation-directory"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#installation-directory","aria-label":"installation directory permalink"},`\xbb`),`Installation directory`),mdx("p",null,`By default, Packer installs plugins into the plugins directory at `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`$HOME/.config/packer/plugins`),` on Unix and  `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`%APPDATA%\\packer.d\\plugins`),` on Windows, but you can specify a different directory using the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`PACKER_PLUGIN_PATH environment variable. 
Plugin installation requires access to temporary files under `),`TMPDIR\`. If the system's temp directory is non-writable or non-executable, use TMPDIR to override the location of the temporary file store used by Packer.
Refer to the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/packer/docs/configure"},`Packer configuration reference`),` for additional information.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"requirements"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#requirements","aria-label":"requirements permalink"},`\xbb`),`Requirements`),mdx("p",null,`To install a plugin from a remote source, the plugin must meet the following requirements:`),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},`The plugin project must be hosted on GitHub.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},`The repository must be named `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`packer-plugin-<name>`),`.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},`The project must have semantic version tags per the following format: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`v<major>.<minor>.<patch>`),`.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},`The release linked to the tag must be available with a `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`shasums`),` file that indicates which files are available in the release.`)),mdx("h3",{"id":"github-api-token"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#github-api-token","aria-label":"github api token permalink"},`\xbb`),`GitHub API token`),mdx("p",null,`GitHub's public API limits the number of unauthenticated requests per hour from a single IP address. Refer to the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://docs.github.com/en/developers/apps/rate-limits-for-github-apps#normal-user-to-server-rate-limits"},`GitHub rate limits documentation`),` for additional information.`),mdx("p",null,`If you expect to exceed the request rate limit, you can use a GitHub API token to authenticate requests and exceed the rate limit. We recommend setting a GitHub API token when running Packer from a continuous integration server to avoid potential rate limiting errors. Refer to `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"#authenticate-requests-to-the-github-api"},`Authenticate requests to the GitHub API`),` for instructions.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"install-a-plugin"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#install-a-plugin","aria-label":"install a plugin permalink"},`\xbb`),`Install a plugin`),mdx("ol",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ol"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},`In your Packer template file, add the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`required_plugins`),` block to the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`packer`),` block. `)),mdx("li",{parentName:"ol"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},`Specify the name of the plugin and its `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`version`),` and `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`source`),` parameters. Setting a correct `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/packer/docs/templates/hcl_templates/blocks/packer#version-constraints"},`version constraint string`),` is important for
pinning plugin versions for build reproducibility. Refer to the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/packer/docs/templates/hcl_templates/blocks/packer"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`packer`),` block configuration reference`),` for additional information.`),mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},`   The following example configures Packer to install a plugin called `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`happycloud`),`. When the template is initialized, Packer downloads version 2.7.0 or newer of the plugin from GitHub:`),mdx("pre",{parentName:"li"},mdx("code",{parentName:"pre"},`\`\`\`hcl
packer {
  required_plugins {
    happycloud = {
      version = ">= 2.7.0"
      source = "github.com/hashicorp/happycloud"
    }
  }
}

\`\`\`
`))),mdx("li",{parentName:"ol"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},`Run the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`packer init`),` command. metadata.title: Packer by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Packer helps you create golden images for multiple platforms from a single source configuration.
